ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Just another newb
ygData.msgSnippet: Thank you for the welcome and you are right in that I am able to play and not feel as if I am neglecting him.  He is able to play much more than I as he works
ygData.messageBody:
Thank you for the welcome and you are right in that I
am able to play and not feel as if I am neglecting
him. He is able to play much more than I as he works
from home so his high level characters have others
that he hunts with and he saves his newer characters
to help me along. Whodda thunk one could get so
hooked on our "virtual" lives (smiles)...I look
forward to learning from all of you and appreciate
having this list to go to...It answers questions I
didn't know to ask and also lets me see some things I
can look forward to

Naara

--- mlockridge01 <MLockridge01@...> wrote:
> Welcome to the game. You are already way ahead
> having someone in your
> life also sharing your virtual life. In that way you
> can play without
> neglecting someone, but infact bond with them in a
> very special way.
>
> Sadly, I am on the Zeb server, so our hails will
> have to be here.
> This is a good list, and much fellowship and advice
> shall be found
> here. It is a little slow here right now, but has
> it's busy periods.
>
> I am a halfling druid as my primary. Lvl 30. I am
> also a halfling
> warrior, lvl 8, and a gnome magician, lvl 3. I have
> worked my primary
> most of the time, but now am attending a bit more to
> my alts.
>
> Feel free to ask questions here. This is a great
> place to share
> adventures, get advice, and share what you have
> learned.
>
> Barto Proudfoot
> Halfling Druid
> Zeb server
>
> --- In EverQuest@y..., "masterkiis_nara"
> <masterkiis_nara@y...> wrote:
> > I am really new at the game (have been playing
> only about a
> > month)...i am on the Ayonae Ro server with a
> couple of characters
> > (lvl 9 Barb Warrior and lvl 5 Cleric...told you I
> was new...LOL)
> Was
> > just curious if anyone else in on that
> server...usually am hunting
> > with the love of my life who is teaching me the
> game but would be
> fun
> > to pass a friendly "Hail" to those here on the
> list should our
> paths
> > cross...would that be proper and acceptable EQ
> etiquette?? Just
> > curious :-)
> >
> > Naara
>
>
